definition: to put together/to make up (a set)/to round up (a number to a convenient multiple)/resulting in...
to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng

sentences.chinese: 加上这一件就凑成全套了。

sentences.english: He planned to tag old articles together to make a book.
sentences.chinese: 他计划把旧文章凑成一本书。

sentences.english: I want one more stamp to complete my set.
sentences.chinese: 我再有一枚邮票就凑成一套了。

sentences.english: We're still ten men shy of a full class.
sentences.chinese: 我们还差十个人才能凑成一个班。

sentences.english: You need to match three cards of the same suit.
sentences.chinese: 你需要用三张同花色的牌凑成一副。

sentences.english: We need to rake up two more players to form a team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要物色两名队员才能凑成一个队。

sentences.english: The vet had improvised a harness.
sentences.chinese: 兽医临时凑成了一副马具。

sentences.english: I need one more stamp to complete my collection.
sentences.chinese: 我所收集的邮票还差一张才凑成整套。

definition: to scrape together enough (people, money etc)
to collect all the bits to make a whole
to put sth together from component parts
to count out (a sum of money etc)
to serve as a stopgap/to make up a shortfall in the number of people
assembled at random/a motley collection
to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity
a straight (poker, mahjong)
two (colloquial equivalent of 兩個|两个)/both/some
to get together
lit. one half equals zero point five (division rule in abacus reckoning)/to share fairly between two parties/to go fifty-fifty
even number
to achieve with difficulty/only just up to the task/barely adequate
to make uniform/to even up/to make good a deficiency
As You Like It, comedy by Shakespeare
to everyone's delight and satisfaction
couple/pair
